alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 10:11AM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move from the eastern Great Lakes States on Wednesday and then across southern New England late Wednesday night and Thursday. Snow is expected to overspread the area from west to east Wednesday night and may be heavy at times. Sleet is expected to mix in late Wednesday night and especially Thursday. Another period of snow may occur Thursday night into Friday with more minor accumulations possible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and sleet expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 12 inches and sleet accumulations around one quarter of an inch across the south. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. The potential exists for snowbands that will bring periods of locally heavy snowfall late Wednesday night, which will lead to rapid snow accumulations and extremely dangerous travel conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
